message.content:
For simplicity, we set
\[\frac{3x+5}{x^2-x-42}=\frac{A}{x-7}+\frac{B}{x+6}=\frac{A(x+6)+B(x-7)}{x^2-x-42} = \frac{(A+B)x+6A-7B}{x^2-x-42}\]
Comparing numerators, we obtain the system of equations
\begin{align*}
A+B &= 3, \\
6A-7B &= 5.
\end{align*}Multiplying the first equation by 7, we get $7A + 7B = 21.$  Subtracting this from $6A - 7B = 5,$ we get $-A = -16,$ so $A = 16.$  Substituting into $A + B = 3,$ we get $16 + B = 3,$ so $B = -13.$  Therefore, $(A,B) = \boxed{(16,-13)}.$
